top_comments.comment: We cannot say koweit, emiratis and saoudis people are not responsible of the heat : they are rich from oil and produce more carbon than anyone in the world
Imagine just eating a whole ghost pepper chillie in the middle of the humid 50°C scorching sun. Just imagine how that would feel.

comments_since_last_sample.body: become vegan to reduce global heating
Umm, that's how deserts work i guess
Imagine just eating a whole ghost pepper chillie in the middle of the humid 50°C scorching sun. Just imagine how that would feel.

This is terrifying. I'm so sorry for Kuwaitis having to go through this. It must be torture. And I love intense heat (38 - 44 degrees). I lived in Oman for 3 years, and it felt like heaven for me most of the time. But, I do remember three days in summer 2014 that were so hot that even I could not bear to be outside. It wasn't 50, but it was close. Everyone said it was very abnormal. Luckily, it only lasted for those three days. I never thought I would complain about heat. I hate the cold. But I would have treasured the cold during those three days of hellish heat in 2014:(
How evil is it to have a fury dog in such a hot country. Pure stupidity.
